description: Functional and what I expected. UI looks a bit outdated, but that's only minor.

The app does not have an option for batch selection.
It saves only to PNG which makes the picture's size way higher than the original PDF itself.
It doesn't have an option to select files from external storage, which makes me copy the files to the local drive so I can convert them.
I thought it can process all pages from one file, but not. it works with one page on one time...

I downloaded this programme in order to enlarge and 'edit' a number of multi-language PDF manuals for some of my tools and equipment.

I was not disappointed!

You simply Load a PDF file, press a button - and a perfect PNG image of that PDF is ready to be Saved, with a name and destination of your choosing. It really is as simple as that. The interface uses just two buttons - one to Load the PDF - the other to create the image.

First, I used "Krop" (from Ubuntu) to select the various required portions of text on the PDF's I needed reduce in volume. 
Krop is non destructive and 'Saves' the cropped file as a separate PDF with a "Cropped" suffix added - so the original PDF remains unaltered.
Krop also has Batch settings which can really speed up the process.
In this way I was able to produce all the pages I required as individual PDF files, - with all the unnecessary and bulky foreign language pages absent.

"Ampare PDF To Image" was then used to convert all the individual PDF files to PNG images. Being PNG,they don't lose definition in the same way as JPG's and the files are small compared to BMP's.

The PNG images were then placed in the correct sequence in the Scribus Word Processor (from Ubuntu).

In this way I was able to create a cut-down file of each manual without the bulk of reams of unnecessary foreign language pages.

Scribus also has the facility to convert text and images to PDF, so I also converted the completed files back to PDF so that I could refer to these manuals via any computer system.

Additionally, I was able to reproduce my machine manuals at a size that could be easily read, and didn't need a magnifying glass to be able to see the words and diagrams!

This may seem to some a rather 'Long Winded' way of working, but It didn't take very long - and working on each page individually ensured that nothing was accidentally omitted and large blank spaces were avoided. I was very pleased with the quality of the finished results.

My thanks to the developer(s) for this application. I found it very useful, and will no doubt be using it again,

One niggly complaint about "Ampare PDF To Image" - I could find no way of reloading a second PDF into the program. I had to 'Close' the application and immediately reload it to perform the next operation.  However, the programme is so light that it loaded almost instantly - but a "New", or a "Reload" button would be an easy addition.

I hope this review helps someone.
Thanks for reading this far.
ThisisI.
It functions but the default resolution is low and there's no option that I can find to increase it
great to convert PDF to PNG. the open/save dialog is out of place but the app works fine.
summary: great to convert PDF to PNG

description: If you want to convert a pdf document, every page has to be treated separately. No page-1 to page-x.
Yo suelo convertir unas cuantas paginas de PDF a imagen y es perfecta; no le doy más uso, por eso no la ha probado profundamente.
me parese muy especial para colah o ocasiones
works fine! . cons: you have to select one page of the pdf to export as image and then after it is exported press "next" for exporting each page individualy.
